title: Add backoff timing to witness patrol formula
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The witness patrol formula cycles too fast, sending 10+ pings to deacon in 30 seconds.

Root cause: mol-witness-patrol.formula.toml loop-or-exit step creates a new wisp and continues immediately without any delay.

Fix: Add await-signal with backoff (similar to deacon patrol) in the loop-or-exit step. Suggested: 30s base, 5m max backoff.

Affected file: .beads/formulas/mol-witness-patrol.formula.toml
close_reason: Added await-signal with backoff (30s base, 2x multiplier, 5m max) to loop-or-exit step in mol-witness-patrol.formula.toml

title: Fix: @ngrok/ngrok package not found on startup
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

When running the startup script, we get this error:

```
[frontend] ‚ùå Failed to start ngrok tunnel: Error [ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND]: Cannot find package '@ngrok/ngrok' imported from /Users/will/Projects/Saults/gastown-boy/frontend/node_modules/.vite-temp/vite.config.ts.timestamp-1768363888591-b7a86eba5edf9.mjs
```

## Problem
The @ngrok/ngrok package was referenced in vite.config.ts but never installed as a dependency.

## Fix
1. Add @ngrok/ngrok to package.json dependencies
2. Run npm install
3. Verify the startup script works without the ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND error

## Verification
After fix, running npm run dev should:
- Start without module not found errors
- Successfully create ngrok tunnel
- Display the ngrok URL in settings
close_reason: Added graceful error handling - package is in package.json, users need npm install after pull

title: Fix beads endpoint to read from town beads (~/gt/.beads/)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

**Problem:**
The gastown_boy UI beads tab is reading from the wrong beads database.

**Current behavior:**
- Backend reads from `gastown_boy/.beads/` (shows gb-* beads only)
- New beads created by Mayor at town level (hq-*) don't appear

**Expected behavior:**
- Backend should read from `~/gt/.beads/` (town beads)
- All hq-* beads should be visible in the UI

**Root cause:**
The backend is likely running `bd list` from the gastown_boy directory instead of the town root.

**Fix:**
Update gt-executor or beads service to run bd commands from `~/gt` (town root) or explicitly specify the beads database path.

**Related:**
See `.claude/rules/00-critical-scope.md` for architectural context.

title: Fix: ngrok authtoken not detected despite being configured
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

User has already run `ngrok config add-authtoken <token>` but the Vite plugin still shows:

```
[frontend] ‚ùå ngrok authtoken not configured
[frontend] üí° Run: ngrok config add-authtoken <your-token>
```

## Problem
The ngrok Vite plugin is not detecting the authtoken that was configured via the ngrok CLI.

## Investigation needed
1. Where does `ngrok config` store the authtoken? (~/.ngrok2/ngrok.yml or ~/.config/ngrok/ngrok.yml)
2. How is the Vite plugin checking for the authtoken?
3. Is there a mismatch between where ngrok CLI stores it vs where the plugin looks?

## Fix
Make the plugin properly detect the authtoken from the standard ngrok config location, OR use the NGROK_AUTHTOKEN environment variable as a fallback.

## Verification
After fix, running npm run dev with a configured authtoken should:
- NOT show the 'authtoken not configured' error
- Successfully start the ngrok tunnel
close_reason: Fixed authtoken detection - supports NGROK_AUTHTOKEN env var, better error messages

if (\!result.data || \!Array.isArray(result.data.messages)) {

if (\!result.data || \!Array.isArray(result.data)) {

description:
dispatched_by: mayor

**Goal:** Investigate approaches for tmux-like session preview functionality in gastown_boy UI.

## Research Areas

### 1. Mini Terminal Preview Window
When attached to a gt tmux session, the tmux switch command shows a preview of other terminals. Investigate:
- How can we achieve a similar effect in gastown_boy UI?
- What would a mini terminal viewing window look like that shows the current state of an agent's tmux session?
- Technical approaches (tmux capture-pane, PTY streaming, etc.)

### 2. Agent Navigation Commands
Check if `gt next` and `gt prev` commands exist for cycling through agents:
- Do these commands exist currently?
- If not, would they be useful to implement?
- Could these power PREV/NEXT navigation buttons in the UI?

## Deliverable
Recommend a solution with:
- Technical approach for terminal preview
- Whether to use/create gt next/prev commands
- UI/UX suggestions for < PREV and NEXT > navigation

comments.author: gastown_boy/polecats/ace
comments.text:
## Research Findings

### 1. gt next/prev Commands - DO NOT EXIST

Checked the gt CLI - `gt next` and `gt prev` commands don't exist. The closest alternatives are:
- `gt agents` - tmux popup menu for session switching (no cycling)
- `gt polecat list` - list polecats

**Recommendation:** These commands would be useful to implement. They could cycle through agents in a defined order (mayor ‚Üí deacon ‚Üí witness ‚Üí refinery ‚Üí polecats) and enable keyboard-driven navigation both in tmux and potentially in the web UI.

### 2. Mini Terminal Preview - TECHNICAL APPROACHES

#### Option A: Simple Pre-rendered Text (RECOMMENDED)
- Use existing `gt peek <agent>` which wraps `tmux capture-pane`
- Returns plain text (last N lines of terminal output)
- Render in a `<pre>` element with monospace font
- Pros: Simple, fast, no new dependencies
- Cons: Static snapshot, no ANSI color support

#### Option B: xterm.js (Full Terminal Emulation)
- Industry-standard web terminal emulator (powers VS Code terminal)
- GPU-accelerated, full ANSI/Unicode support
- Pros: Rich rendering, handles colors/cursor positioning
- Cons: Heavier (~200KB), overkill for read-only preview

#### Option C: ansi-to-html + Pre
- Lightweight ANSI escape code parser (~10KB)
- Convert captured output to colored HTML
- Pros: Preserves colors, minimal overhead
- Cons: No cursor/interactive support

### 3. Recommended Implementation

**Phase 1: Static Preview Panel**
1. Add backend endpoint: `GET /api/agents/:id/peek?lines=50`
2. Call `gt peek <agent> -n 50` and return raw text
3. Add expandable preview panel to AgentCard/AgentChip components
4. Use `<pre>` with monospace font for initial render
5. Add auto-refresh toggle (5-10 second polling when expanded)

**Phase 2: PREV/NEXT Navigation (requires gt changes)**
1. Implement `gt next` and `gt prev` commands in gastown
2. Add navigation buttons to UI header or agent detail view
3. Wire buttons to call new backend endpoints that invoke gt commands

title: Add contextual action buttons for bead states
description:
Add contextual action buttons to the beads tab based on bead state.

**Current:** Only 'SLING' action for unassigned open beads.

**New actions by state:**

| State | Actions | Description |
|-------|---------|-------------|
| open (unassigned) | SLING | Dispatch to polecat (existing) |
| open (assigned) | NUDGE | Send nudge to assigned worker |
| hooked | STOP, UNHOOK | Tell worker to stop/release the bead |
| in_progress | STOP | Request worker to pause/stop work |
| blocked | UNBLOCK | Mark as unblocked (if blocker resolved) |
| closed | REOPEN | Reopen the bead |

**Special actions:**
- **MERGE** - For beads with code ready, instruct refinery to merge
- **ESCALATE** - Send to mayor for attention

**Implementation:**
1. Determine available actions based on bead status + assignee
2. Show action buttons in the ACTION column
3. Each action sends appropriate mail/command:
   - STOP/UNHOOK ‚Üí mail to assignee with instructions
   - MERGE ‚Üí mail to refinery with branch info
   - NUDGE ‚Üí gt nudge to worker session
   - REOPEN ‚Üí bd reopen command

**Check `.claude/rules/00-critical-scope.md` for scope context.**

title: Fix logo sizing: globals.css overriding layered styles
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

BUG: Logo doesn't resize responsively.

Root cause: In globals.css, there's an unlayered rule:
```css
h1 { font-size: 2rem; }
```

This overrides the `.app-header h1` rules in main.css because those are inside `@layer components`. Unlayered styles always beat layered styles in CSS cascade.

Fix options:
1. Move the h1 rule in globals.css into `@layer base`
2. Or add `!important` to .app-header h1 (not ideal)
3. Or remove the generic h1 size rule from globals.css

Files:
- frontend/src/styles/globals.css (line ~256)
- frontend/src/styles/main.css (already correct, just being overridden)
close_reason: Wrapped typography rules in globals.css with @layer base so component layer styles can override them properly
